conclusion: Plan to analyze the velocity-time graph for object B to determine acceleration trend.

The image shows a velocity-time graph with two curves labeled A and B. Curve A is a straight line, indicating constant velocity. Curve B is a parabola, starting from a point, then decreasing, and finally increasing again. The time interval from 0 to $t_2$ is marked on the horizontal axis.
Identify the motion of object B: The graph shows that object B's velocity changes over time. Initially, the velocity decreases, as indicated by the downward slope from $t_1$ to $t_2$.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
Determine acceleration: For object B, the acceleration during the interval from 0 to $t_2$ is determined by the slope of the velocity curve.
Analyze the slope: The slope of the velocity curve for object B is negative from $t_1$ to $t_2$. This indicates that the velocity is decreasing over this time interval.
Conclusion on acceleration: Since the velocity is decreasing, the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to $t_2$ is negative.
The acceleration of object B is negative during the time interval 0 to $t_2$.
